questions.question: What does Le Chatelier’s Principle state?

answers.b: Systems at equilibrium remain unaffected by external changes
answers.c: A system at equilibrium adjusts to oppose any change imposed on it

explanations.a: Incorrect. Reactions do not always go to completion.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Equilibrium systems are affected by external changes.
explanations.c: Correct. According to Le Chatelier’s Principle, the system adjusts to oppose the change.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Product and reactant ratios depend on the reaction's equilibrium constant.

questions.question: If temperature is increased in an exothermic reaction at equilibrium, the system will:

answers.d: Increase the rate of forward reaction permanently

explanations.a: Incorrect. Increasing temperature shifts equilibrium in the direction that absorbs heat (endothermic).
explanations.b: Correct. For an exothermic reaction, increasing temperature favors the reverse (endothermic) reaction.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The equilibrium position changes with temperature.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Rate may temporarily change, but equilibrium determines long-term composition.

questions.question: Which of the following changes will shift the equilibrium to the product side?

answers.d: Decreasing pressure in a gaseous system with fewer moles on the product side

explanations.a: Incorrect. Removing reactants shifts equilibrium to the left.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Adding products shifts equilibrium to the left.
explanations.c: Correct. Adding reactants drives the reaction toward products.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Decreasing pressure favors the side with more gas molecules.

questions.question: In a gaseous reaction where the product side has fewer moles of gas, increasing pressure will:

answers.a: Shift equilibrium to the product side
answers.b: Shift equilibrium to the reactant side

explanations.a: Correct. Increased pressure favors the side with fewer gas molecules.
explanations.b: Incorrect. More pressure shifts equilibrium toward fewer moles.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Pressure changes shift equilibrium but don’t halt reactions.

questions.question: Which of the following will not affect the position of equilibrium in a closed system?

answers.b: Change in pressure for gaseous reactions

explanations.b: Incorrect. Pressure changes affect gaseous equilibria.
explanations.c: Correct. A catalyst speeds up both forward and reverse reactions equally, so equilibrium position is unchanged.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Temperature changes affect the equilibrium constant.
